duck: Troponymy is the presence of a ‘manner’ relation between two lexemes.

wiki.text:
'Troponymy' is the presence of a ‘manner’ relation between two lexemes.

The notion was originally proposed by Christiane Fellbaum and George
Miller.<ref> p.566</ref> Some examples they gave are “to nibble is to eat in a
certain manner, and to gorge is to eat in a different manner. Similarly, to
traipse or to mince is to walk in some manner”.<ref> p.567</ref>

Troponymy is one of the possible relations between verbs in the semantic network
of the WordNet database.
wiki.title: troponymy
